Reason: The configuration option 'compaction_large_partition_warning_threshold_mb' is performance-sensitive. This is because the configuration directly impacts the system performance by triggering a warning log operation when a compaction operation is performed on partitions larger than the specified threshold value. The code snippet provided shows that the configuration is used to check the size of partitions during compaction and log a warning if the size exceeds the threshold. This operation can be time-expensive and memory-expensive, as it involves checking the size of each partition and logging the warning message. Therefore, the configuration leads to notable performance variations at the system level, making it performance-sensitive.
